intro: Taeniophyllum esetiferum, commonly known as the feather moss, is a small, cryptogamic plant belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, filamentous structure and the presence of specialized cells for water retention. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and closely packed, forming dense mats that help retain moisture. Taeniophyllum esetiferum plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and as a microhabitat for various organisms.
